definition.para: File format, physical medium, and/or dimensions of the original resource.

instructions.para: When the original is non-digital, use a label from one of the entries of the RDA Registry's RDA Carrier Type Vocabulary currently available at https://www.rdaregistry.info/termList/RDACarrierType/
When the original is digital, use media types listed at http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/index.html
For audio WAVE files, enter audio/wav.
When 'Original Format' is the same as the 'Digital Format,' enter the mime type in both fields.
When the original is non-digital, use a label from one of the entries of the RDA Registry's RDA Carrier Type Vocabulary currently available at https://www.rdaregistry.info/termList/RDACarrierType/
When the original is digital, use media types listed at http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/index.html
For audio WAVE files, enter audio/wav.
When the original is non-digital, use a label from one of the entries of the RDA Registry's RDA Carrier Type Vocabulary currently available at https://www.rdaregistry.info/termList/RDACarrierType/
When the original is digital, use media types listed at http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/index.html
For audio WAVE files, enter audio/wav.
Separate multiple formats with a semi-colon.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted a place to describe the format of the original resource.

changeLog.change: Changed dc mappring from "isFormatOf" (which is incorrect, that would bring the resource being described into relation with another resource essentially the same but in another format) to none, as there is no appropriate dc mapping. Also added instructions and examples for @co="all"
